message.name: Polling Message
message.description: Queries the system to determine device addresses and language.

message.name: Feature Abort
message.description: Used as a response to indicate that the device does not support the requested message type, or that it cannot execute it at the present time (Directly addressed)

message.name: Image View On
message.description: Sent by a source device to the TV whenever it enters the active state (alternatively it may send "Text View On") (Directly addressed)

message.name: Give Deck Status
message.description: Used to request the status of a device, regardless of whether or not it is the current active source (Directly addressed)

message.name: Deck Status
message.description: Used to provide a deckâ€™s status to the initiator of the "Give Deck Status" message (Directly addressed)

message.name: Set Menu Language
message.description: Used by a TV or another device to indicate the menu language (Broadcast)

message.name: Standby
message.description: Switches on or all devices into standby mode. Can be used a broadcast message or be addressed to a specific device (Broadcast or Directly addressed)

message.name: User Control Pressed
message.description: Used to indicate that the user pressed a remote control button or switched from one remote control button to another (Directly addressed). This message is used in several features : Device Menu Control,System Audio Control,Remote Control Pass Through

message.name: User Control Release
message.description: Indicates that user released a remote control button (the last one indicated by the "User Control Pressed" message) (Directly addressed). This message is used in several features : Device Menu Control,System Audio Control,Remote Control Pass Through

message.name: Give OSD Name
message.description: Used to request the preferred OSD name of a device for use in menus associated with that device (Directly addressed)

message.name: Set OSD Name
message.description: Used to set the preferred OSD name of a device for use in menus associated with that device (Directly addressed) parameters

message.name: Routing Change
message.description: Sent by a CEC Switch when it is manually switched to inform all other devices on the network that the active route below the switch has changed (Broadcast)

message.name: Active Source
message.description: Used by a new source to indicate that it has started to transmit a stream OR used in response to a "Request Active Source" (Broadcast). This message is used in several features : One Touch Play,Routing Control

message.name: Give Physical Address
message.description: A request to a device to return its physical address. (Directly addressed)

message.name: Report Physical Address
message.description: Used to inform all other devices of the mapping between physical and logical address of the initiator (Broadcast) parameters

message.name: Request Active Source
message.description: Used by a new device to discover the status of the system (Broadcast)

message.name: Device Vendor ID
message.description: Reports the Vendor ID of this device (Broadcast)

message.name: Vendor Remote Button Down
message.description: Indicates that a remote control button has been depressed (Directly addressed or Broadcast)

message.name: Give Device Vendor ID
message.description: Requests the Vendor ID from a device (Directly addressed)

message.name: Give Device Power Status
message.description: Used to determine the current power status of a target device (Directly addressed)

message.name: Report Power Status
message.description: Used to inform a requesting device of the current power status (Directly addressed)

message.name: Get CEC Version
message.description: Used by a device to enquire which version of CEC the target supports (Directly addressed)

message.name: Vendor Command With ID
message.description: Allows vendor specific commands to be sent between two devices or broadcast (Directly addressed or Broadcast)
